intro: Jatropha schweinfurthii subsp. zambica, commonly known as the Zambian physic nut, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, toxic berries that contain seeds used for oil extraction. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it both a valuable resource and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
